Summary: The hotel has a modern and stylish decor in the lobby and ground floor area, with a pool table in the communal area. It is located near a large shopping center with many eating options.

The Ascott Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens and laundry facilities, and has a pool, gym, and children's playroom. It is located in the CBD, near restaurants and a subway station, and contains a Starbucks, mini-mart, and massage center.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention a lively atmosphere. The hotel is described as being located in a quiet area.

The hotel is near Houhai Lake which has a lot of shops, restaurants, public dancing and singing; the hotel is also within walking distance to the hip part of town where all the trendy restaurants are popping up. The hotel is located down a small alley lined with little stores and restaurants off a busy main street lined with restaurants and shops.

The Century Towers Beijing hotel offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens, dining areas, and washer/dryers. A supermarket is located across the street, and the hotel has a small restaurant and a workout room in the basement.
The hotel has a coffee shop with character that doubles as a great bar, but the bar closes at midnight. There is a karaoke bar and nightclub in the hotel, which some reviewers claim are brothels.
The Far East Hotel has a communal courtyard, a basement bar with movies, and a cafe, creating a lively atmosphere where travelers can meet. It is located in a hutong area with shops and restaurants.
The hotel complex includes multiple restaurants including a TGI Friday's, a supermarket, a pub, and a beer garden. The hotel grounds have plenty of trees and paths to wander round.
The hotel is located off the 3rd Ring road near a food street and the US and Japanese embassies. The lobby is clean and 5-star-ish.
The Beijing Hotel is located on the corner of Wangfujing Mall, a main shopping strip, and is connected to the Raffles Hotel. The lobby can be busy and full of people, and it is near a subway stop.
The hotel is centrally located, near shopping centers and tourist attractions like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. It is a large hotel that caters to tour groups.
The hostel has a communal bar area that serves food throughout the day, and a lounge with movies during the day and beers at night. There is also a common area with a TV, stereo, couches, and books.

I am sorry, but the hotel reviews suggest that this hotel is an oasis of peace and quiet, so I cannot recommend it as having a lively atmosphere. It is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, and known for its quiet courtyard.
The hotel features 5 restaurants and is close to several big shopping centers and many local restaurants, all within walking distance. The surrounding neighborhood was described as classy and young.
The Capital Hotel has a bowling alley, 3 bars, and a karaoke bar on site. Some reviewers mention that the lobby is large and often crowded with tour groups.

The China World Hotel's lobby is grand and spacious, often featuring live music, including piano, clarinet, violin, and even opera singers with a small orchestra. The hotel is connected to a high-end shopping mall and is located near a subway station for convenient access to the city.
City Hotel is located next to several good pubs and local restaurants that cater to foreigners. The hotel is close to the subway and easy to get taxis.

I am sorry, but the reviews focus on the hotel's architecture, private access to the Great Wall, and peaceful atmosphere, with some mentioning potential drawbacks in service and maintenance, so they do not contain information about a lively atmosphere. Therefore, I cannot recommend this hotel based on the query.

Courtyard 7 is located near Nanluoguxiang, a street with designer shops, bars, and restaurants. The hotel is in a hutong area with restaurants, and close to clubs like Mao Live House and Yu Gong Yi Shan.

This hotel is connected to the New World Shopping Center, which includes fast food restaurants, a supermarket, and a food court. Additionally, it is located near local restaurants, malls, bars, and coffee shops.
I am sorry, but there is no information about the hotel having a lively atmosphere. The hotel is modern and well-located, with an adjacent mall and restaurants nearby. There is a bar downstairs.
The hotel is centrally located on Wangfujing Street, close to shopping, restaurants, and a night food market. The hotel has a lobby bar with live music and happy hour.
The hotel has a variety of restaurants and an amazing spa with steam and sauna. The atmosphere was noted to be amazing.
The bar was virtually empty but offered good international sports coverage on TV. There are plenty of bars and lounges to relax in.
The hotel has multiple restaurants including a Brazilian restaurant and a lobby bar, and is located next to a small mall with a food court. The hotel sometimes has events with loud music.

The hotel has evening live music in the lobby and is located next to construction, with Parkson opening next door in the future, and is near a subway station. There are also several restaurants within a 10-minute walk.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention if the hotel has a lively atmosphere. The Days Inn Forbidden City is in a great central location within walking distance of many popular tourist locations.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention anything about a lively atmosphere.
The hotel is located in a hutong, surrounded by local shops and restaurants, and has a bar where guests can relax. It is also walking distance to a subway station.
The hotel is located near the Xi'dan area, a trendy area with lots of big shopping malls and bars/restaurants, and the bar on the ground floor has nice drinks. There is also a KTV nearby.

The hotel has a vegas-like mall in the basement with restaurants, small boutiques, spas, and a gym/pool. There is also a Golden Resources Cafeteria in the hotel that offers a buffet for breakfast and dinner.
The hotel has a mix of Chinese and Western guests. The lobby is attractive and the staff are friendly.
Gloria Plaza is a large hotel that caters to large groups and has a grand spacious entrance with a nice lounge area. The breakfast area can get crowded and noisy.
The hotel is described as being dead inside with the Atrium bar lacking in atmosphere. There is often musical entertainment at night and the noise filters through to the rooms.

The Grand Hyatt Beijing has a lively atmosphere with multiple restaurants, a lobby lounge with live music at the Red Moon bar, and is connected to a large upscale shopping mall. It is located near a pedestrian shopping street, the Forbidden City, and other attractions.

The hotel has a lobby bar that seems popular with Westerners and a daily happy hour in the lobby bar with live piano music. There's also a V9 cafeteria that some reviewers found sweet and cutie, recommending it for lovers.
The hotel has a ground floor lobby lounge with live Chinese music and a bar with a jazz band. The hotel is centrally located near a subway station.
The hotel has a disco, snooker table, and bowling alley in the basement. It also has a bar, though the decor is described as dull and outdated by one reviewer.
The hotel is centrally located near shops, restaurants, and a busy mall area that plays loud music from early morning until late. It is also located near a night market, bars, and pubs.
There was no real social scene, the foyer bar never seemed to be open, and there's a small bar on the main floor that was rarely used. The hotel is near many restaurants and convenience stores.

The hotel is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, within walking distance of the Houhai bar area, which may provide a lively atmosphere. The hotel itself is described as basic, and some rooms may be small.
The hotel has multiple restaurants and bars, and live music is available in the evenings. The Executive Lounge offers complimentary drinks and happy hour with hot foods.

The Hilton Wangfujing has a bar called Flames that is designed to attract the trendy, young Beijing crowd and also features live music in the lounge next door. There is also a night food market nearby with a variety of food vendors.

The Holiday Inn Lido has a pub called The Pig & Thistle that some reviewers describe as lively with attractive and friendly Chinese ladies, while another reviewer considers the hotel bar one of the worst hooker joints around. There is also a bowling alley in the complex.
The Holiday Inn Central Plaza has a bar with a resident singer Mon-Fri, and a joy bar in the basement. Nan Luogu Xiang, Beijing is full of bars and places to chill out.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews describe the hotel's atmosphere with words like "lively". Would you like me to summarize the reviews based on other criteria?

The hotel has a swimming pool, a spa, and a beauty salon and is located near shops and restaurants, including Western chains like Pizza Hut and McDonald's. Some reviewers mentioned a lively atmosphere in the hotel's restaurants, including a buffet with international cuisine.
This hotel attracts many domestic bus tour groups and is located near the Ethnic Minority People's Park. The hotel is also near a Chinatown shopping center with fast food places and stalls.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain any information about the hotel atmosphere.

The hotel is above Focus Mall, across from Stellar International Cineplex with 20 restaurants, a liquor store, and a department store with a supermarket. It is located next to Hua Tang Shopping center with many restaurants.
The hotel has a KTV karaoke lounge with private booths. It is located in a normal residential area where guests can experience local life.
This hotel is not recommended for Westerners, as it caters less to them. Reviews mention limited English-speaking staff and a lack of Western-style amenities.

Hotel Cote Cour is located down a narrow road in an old Hutong, near shopping areas and a short taxi ride to major sightseeing spots. The hotel has a lounge area and outdoor courtyard where guests can relax.
Hotel G has a lively bar scene that is popular with expats and locals, along with brightly colored lights on the building's exterior. The hotel is located near clubs and bars.
Ibis Sanyuan Hotel is located next to the Sanyuanqiao subway station on line 10, the first stop on the Airport Express train. The hotel is in a new development area and near a Western grocery.
The hotel has multiple restaurants and bars, including a revolving restaurant on the 29th floor. There are touts, prostitutes, and beggars outside the hotel at night.

The New Otani Chang Fu Gong Hotel in Beijing has a casual buffet restaurant and a pricier Japanese restaurant onsite, as well as a lobby bar. The hotel complex also contains a health club that includes a squash court, indoor swimming pool and fitness aerobic room, spas with soaking tubs and saunas.
The hotel is connected to a shopping mall and subway exit, located across from the Beijing train station. There is a karaoke club and a lobby lounge.
The hotel is near Sanlitun bar Street. There are also several restaurants within easy walking distance from the hotel and a couple of small supermarkets.
Located in a busy shopping district with many restaurants, the hotel is near the subway and has a taxi stand outside. The area is lively during the day but quiet at night.
The hotel is located in the Olympic Stadium area and has a lobby lounge with live piano music. However, some guests have noted that the hotel can feel deserted, particularly during the slow season.

The Steak Exchange bar has a live piano player from Tuesday till Saturday, playing excellent jazz music. The hotel also has a club lounge that offers a happy hour with a nice selection of hot and cold finger foods and drinks.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews indicate that this hotel has a lively atmosphere. The reviews focus on the hotel's location, cleanliness, and service.

Charlie’s Bar offers a wide range of libations and live music in the evenings, as well as food, and the lobby hosts a lovely café serving fresh loose leaf teas. Hustlers approach men walking alone at night in front of the hotel.

The hotel has a theatre inside with Beijing Opera performances and at least 4 different restaurants and a bar. The lobby area is without charm and not welcoming, and there is no nice bar spot to relax.

The Jinqiao Hotel Apartments has a bar and a "Western"-themed restaurant with servers in cowboy attire; the ground floor also hosts a hair salon, gift shop, travel agency, and supermarket. One reviewer mentioned a lively breakfast buffet.

The Joy City Hotel is connected to the Joy City shopping mall via a walkway on the ground and 6th floor, offering access to restaurants, shops and ATM's. The hotel also has a lobby bar with a barman who is a snooker player.
The hotel has a bar on the first level and a small casino promotion with card tables. The hotel is located next to an upscale shopping mall with shops and restaurants.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention a lively atmosphere at this hotel. The reviews focus on its modern design, location near tourist attractions, and cleanliness.
Kelly's Courtyard has a glass-covered courtyard, rooftop terrace, and mezzanine lounge. Jazzy ambient music is played throughout the day.

The hotel bar is a frequent meeting point for business travelers, and the hotel has a Paulaner bar that serves German food and beer in a garden setting. There is also a variety of restaurants within the hotel complex, including German, Italian, Chinese, and international cuisine.

The hotel is near Sanlitun, an evening entertainment area with bars featuring live bands, and a Latin bar/lounge called "Mojito" is around the corner. A fashion mall is diagonally across from the hotel.
Lee Gardens Service Apartment is located in the Wanfujing area, close to shopping, restaurants, and the Donganmen night food market. The area is described as a dynamic part of Beijing.

The Legendale Hotel in Beijing is located near a shopping center, Starbucks, and various dining options, with the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square a 15-20 minute walk away. The hotel has an indoor pool and a health club with jacuzzies, a steam bath, and a sauna.

I am sorry, but the reviews suggest that the hotel is located far from the city center, so it is likely to have a quiet atmosphere. However, the hotel has recreational facilities including indoor tennis courts, a bowling alley, a recreation center/gymnasium, and a pool.
The hotel is located in the Chaoyang district, which contains commercial and nightlife/restaurant activity. There is a cafe around the corner and a 7-Eleven across the circle driveway.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention this hotel having a lively atmosphere.
The hotel has a Bally's Fitness Center connected to the hotel, and the pool area is shared with Bally's members. The hotel is located near cheap restaurants frequented by locals.

This new hotel, built in 2009 and located in the Chaoyang district, offers spacious 2-bedroom apartments with fully equipped kitchens, multiple flat-screen TVs, and amenities like a gym, swimming pool, sauna, and steam room. It is a 30-40 minute taxi ride to the Forbidden City and a 10-15 minute taxi ride to a high-end mall.

The hotel has modern and trendy bars, including an open lobby bar and a Ruby Bar (though the Ruby Bar's opening was scheduled for late October). Some reviewers noted that the restaurants and bars lacked atmosphere due to the low number of guests.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information regarding a lively atmosphere. Most reviews state that it is away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Michael's House has a cozy courtyard that encourages socializing with other guests. The hotel is located in a real Beijing neighborhood, not a touristy area, giving guests a chance to experience the local lifestyle.
Located on Wangfujing Street, this hotel is near shopping areas, a night food market, and a subway station. It is across the road from the Wangfujing shopping area and next to a shopping mall.
The hotel is located near the Chaoyang theater with easy access to the subway and a 10-minute ride to the Silk Market. There is a bar/cafe in the lobby and a convenience store on the 7th floor.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention anything about the hotel having a lively atmosphere.
The hotel has a lobby bar and is near Wangfujing shopping street. The hotel has evening entertainment in the bar with a pianist and a nearby night food market.
The hotel has a gallery bar with a live jazz pianist and a coffee shop that is open 24 hours. Some guests have noted a lively atmosphere while others have found the hotel to lack atmosphere.

Oakwood Residence is located near modern shopping malls, restaurants, and bars, with Sanlitun shopping and bar street a 10-15 minute walk away. The property offers a spa and is centrally located on the Eastern 3rd ring of the city.
I am sorry, but there is no information about the hotel having a lively atmosphere. The reviews focus on the hotel's cleanliness, proximity to transportation, and value.
The hotel is near the Hutong area by the lake, which offers nightlife, bars, and restaurants. There are also various eating places along the main road in front of the hotel.
The hotel has a bowling alley, snooker rooms, and football tables. It is located near a street full of restaurants and has a supermarket and McDonald's nearby.

The hotel is located a 10 RMB cab ride away from Sanlitun Lu (bar street) and has a garden complex next door that is a central point for early morning exercises. A small shopping arcade is available with local items for sale.
The hotel breakfast is included and is a place to meet other expats; the GM goes out of his way to make guests feel part of a family. There's a Manager’s reception each evening.

The Park Hyatt Beijing features a bar with a three-man band and a restaurant/bar (China Grill & Bar) on the 65th and 66th floors offering nightscape views. Xiu is another venue, but reviews mention a negative experience related to service and management issues.
The hotel has a lobby bar with live music at times and is near a hot pot restaurant and Da Dong Duck Restaurant. It is also within walking distance of the Night Market.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention anything about a lively atmosphere. The reviews focus on the hotel's distance from the city center, the quality of the rooms, and the staff's limited English.
The hotel lobby area contains a bar which was relaxing to sit in at the end of the day. The breakfast room was very busy.

The hotel is located at the north end of Wangfujing shopping street, near shops, restaurants, and the Forbidden City, and the coffee shop/bar was often busy. There is a pianist in the lobby every night.

This hotel has a variety of dining options, a bar, a pool and spa, and is located next to a shopping mall with restaurants. The hotel is located a short walk from the subway, which provides easy access to the city center.
The hotel is located on a street full of restaurants and near a restaurant street, with many restaurants in the close vicinity. There is a supermarket on the ground floor.
The Raffles Beijing is located next to the Wangfujiang street and close to Tiananmen Square and connects to a string of indoor offices and shopping. There is a happy hour every evening in the bar.

The hotel has a bar on the 4th floor, but it closes early and the staff is not very familiar with English. The hotel is located in a newly young chic shopping area with a big shopping mall beside the hotel.
The hotel bar lounge has a great group singing, and there is also live entertainment in the lounge. The hotel is located on a long street full of restaurants and bars filled with locals.
This hotel is large, impersonal, and caters to westerners. It is also frequented by large groups attending conferences or on tours.
The hotel bar, Centro, is trendy and a "hot spot" for late-night drinks, attracting many locals. The hotel also has a wine bar, coffee shop and sandwich shop.

The Shatan Hotel is located on a lively back street (hutong) with local shops and restaurants, offering an authentic Beijing experience. The street is busy with locals and can be noisy, but the hotel provides a central location near the Forbidden City.
The Sofitel Wanda Beijing has several restaurants and bars, including the M Bar. There is an adjacent cinema and shopping complex, as well as a KTV.
The hotel is located near the Guloudaije subway stop on Line 2 and in the hutong, within a 10-15 minute walk to a "bar street". Some reviewers noted noise from the hallway and slamming doors.

This hotel is located in the Haidian district, near a supermarket and subway line, but a bit further from the city center and Chaoyang. It offers apartments with amenities like air conditioning and a pool, but some guests have noted cleanliness and maintenance issues.
The hotel is located in the Hutong area with restaurants and shops nearby, offering cultural experiences and tours. Guests can learn how to make dumplings, and a karaoke machine is available.

I am sorry, but there is no information about the hotel having a lively atmosphere in the reviews. However, the hotel is in a central location near Wangfujing shopping street, restaurants, and tourist attractions.
The Swissotel Beijing is next to an acrobat theater and near the San Li Tun bar district, with a lobby bar and restaurants. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel is near local eating places.

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing neighborhood (hutong) and has a central courtyard that serves as a common area for guests to meet. The hotel offers activities such as dumpling-making sessions and communal dinners with the owner and staff.
The hotel is located 45 minutes from the lively heart of Beijing and offers private access to the Summer Palace. It is described as a secluded historical residence with interconnecting courtyards.
The hotel has a rooftop bar with views over Beijing, but it can be quiet depending on the time of year. The hotel also has a modern and funky design.

The Opposite House is located in the Sanlitun Chaoyang district, packed with restaurants, bars and shops, and has a bar/club downstairs called Punk. It's located directly on Sanlitun street to enjoy the vibrant nightlife of Beijing.
The hotel has a lobby bar that acts as a meeting place with a mix of hotel guests and locals. There is a jazz trio that plays in the lobby bar late into the evenings.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention if the hotel has a lively atmosphere.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention a lively atmosphere at the hotel. The reviews do mention a pool with a movie screen, a lobby tea cafe, and several restaurants.
The hotel is located next to the Shin Kong Place shopping mall. The hotel bar/lounge is comfortable, provides nibblers with drinks, and plays different music each night.
I did not find information about a lively atmosphere in the provided reviews. However, the lobby bar has live Asian music.

Mix bar has a great ambiance and beer selection, and Touch bar has one of the best mixed drink menus. There are several interesting bars and restaurants in the hotel, as well as proximity to Sanlitun shopping and nightlife.

The Westin Beijing Financial Street has a lobby bar that can be noisy with staff traffic due to conference room setup, and a lively Sunday brunch with a massive selection of food and champagne. However, it is primarily a business hotel in the financial district, which becomes deserted after office hours.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel has a large internal atrium with music, dining, and a bar, and some reviewers mention a piano in the atrium lobby with live music during dinner. There are also karaoke bars and lounges that are run by a third party.

This hotel is located just off Wangfujing Street, a main shopping street, and close to a pedestrian street and night market. It is situated on a quiet hutong but within a short walk of a busy street corner with subway access.
The hotel has a karaoke bar on the 2nd floor, and noise from it can be heard in some of the rooms. There is also a spa/salon on the second floor.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention if this hotel has a lively atmosphere.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention if the hotel has a lively atmosphere. The hotel is modern, caters to business travelers, and has a good gym.
The Wangfujing Grand Hotel is located near a night market and the Wangfujing shopping street. There is a nightclub with show girls/escorts in the hotel.
The hotel has several restaurants, cafes and a pub, some of which stay open late, as well as bowling and proximity to kung-fu shows. The hotel hosts conventions and seminars.
The hotel has leisure facilities including an 8 lane bowling alley, table tennis, 4 pool tables, a swimming pool, and a gym. There are many restaurants and upscale shops in the surrounding area.
Xinyuan Inn is located in a modern, touristy hutong in a fun and active area. The hotel is within reasonable walking distance of many sights and has good bus access.

The hotel is located near the Xidan shopping area, a major shopping district with department stores and a wedding dress mall, and has multiple restaurants within the building. It is also conveniently located near a supermarket, taxi services, and the Xidan subway station.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information about the hotel's atmosphere. They focus on the hotel's location, cleanliness, staff, and amenities.
The hotel is located in the University District, a 5-minute taxi ride from the nearest Underground station, and near a supermarket and market. Local restaurants cater to students.

The hotel is located in a hutong and near the Beijing Train Station and subway, making it convenient for exploring the city. Some reviewers mention a lively atmosphere with a mix of international visitors, especially during the Olympics.
